page.title: 06OUNDLE PUBLIC SCHOOL 2
page.content: .../... Some boys take the school's own special test. Oundle School has eleven boarding - houses, each of which is supervised by a Housemaster who is also a member of the teaching staff. The school also has a beautiful chapel built in the 1920's and a Great Hall used for lectures, assemblies and other events. The school is particularly well-known for its science and engineering courses, having been one of the first major public schools to widen its curriculum from the previously narrow classical base. Each boy is expected to take an average of nine 'O'-levels and three 'A'-levels after which many enter universities. Oundle School students regularly achieve places at Oxford and Cambridge, which shows the importance attached to academic success.
